stk.calculators.ga.mutators module¶

Defines mutators.

Mutators are objects which mutate molecules. They inherit Mutator and define a method mutate(). This method must take a single molecule and return a mutant.

Examples of how mutators work can be seen the documentation of the various Mutator classes, for example RandomBuildingBlock, SimilarBuildingBlock or RandomMutation.

Extending stk: Making new mutators.¶

Mutators must simple inherit the Mutator class and define a method called mutate(), which take a single molecule and returns a mutant molecule. There are no requirements besides this.

exception stk.calculators.ga.mutators.MutationError¶

Bases: Exception

Used for errors which occuring during mutation operations.

__init__¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

with_traceback()¶

Exception.with_traceback(tb) – set self.__traceback__ to tb and return self.

class stk.calculators.ga.mutators.RandomBuildingBlock(building_blocks, key, duplicate_building_blocks=False)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.ga.mutators.Mutator

Substitutes random building blocks.

This mutator takes a MacroMolecule and substitutes the building blocks with one chosen at random from a given set.

building_blocks¶

A group of molecules which are used to replace building blocks in molecules being mutated.

Type:list of StructUnit
key¶

A function which takes a StructUnit and returns True or False. This function is applied to every building block of the molecule being mutated. Building blocks which returned True are liable for substition by one of the molecules in building_blocks.

Type:function
duplicate_building_blocks¶

Indicates whether the building blocks used to construct the mutant must all be unique.

Type:bool

Examples

# Create a molecule which is to be mutated.
bb1 = StructUnit2.smiles_init('NCCN', ['amine'])
bb2 = StructUnit2.smiles_init('O=CCC=O', ['aldehyde'])
polymer = Polymer([bb1, bb2], Linear('AB', [0, 0], n=3))

# Create molecules used to substitute building blocks.
building_blocks = [
    StructUnit2.smiles_init('NC[Si]CCN', ['amine']),
    StructUnit2.smiles_init('NCCCCCCCN', ['amine']),
    StructUnit2.smiles_init('NC1CCCCC1N', ['amine'])
]

# Create the mutator.
random_bb = RandomBuildingBlock(
    building_blocks=building_blocks,
    key=lambda mol: mol.func_group_infos[0].name == 'amine'
)

# Mutate a molecule.
mutant1 = random_bb.mutate(polymer)

# Mutate the molecule a second time.
mutant2 = random_bb.mutate(polymer)

# Mutate a mutant.
mutant3 = random_bb.mutate(mutant1)
__init__(building_blocks, key, duplicate_building_blocks=False)¶

Initializes a RandomBuildingBlock instance.

Parameters:
  • building_blocks (list of StructUnit) – A group of molecules which are used to replace building blocks in molecules being mutated.
  • key (function) – A function which takes a StructUnit and returns True or False. This function is applied to every building block of the molecule being mutated. Building blocks which returned True are liable for substition by one of the molecules in building_blocks.
  • duplicate_building_blocks (bool, optional) – Indicates whether the building blocks used to construct the mutant must all be unique.
mutate(mol)¶

Substitute a building block at random.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The molecule which is to have its building block substituted.
Returns:The produced mutant.
Return type:MacroMolecule
class stk.calculators.ga.mutators.RandomMutation(*mutators, weights=None)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.ga.mutators.Mutator

Uses a random Mutator to carry out mutations.

mutators¶

Mutator objects which are used to carry out the mutations.

Type:tuple of Mutator
weights¶

The probability that each Mutator will be selected to carry out a mutation.

Type:list of float

Examples

# Create a molecule which is to be mutated.
bb1 = StructUnit2.smiles_init('NCCN', ['amine'])
bb2 = StructUnit3.smiles_init('O=CCC(=O)CC=O', ['aldehyde'])
cage = Cage([bb1, bb2], FourPlusSix())

# Create the first mutator.
topologies = [
    TwoPlusThree(),
    EightPlusTwelve(),
    Dodecahedron()
]
random_topology = RandomTopology(topologies)

# Create the second and third mutator.
building_blocks = [
    StructUnit2.smiles_init('NC[Si]CCN', ['amine']),
    StructUnit2.smiles_init('NCCCCCCCN', ['amine']),
    StructUnit2.smiles_init('NC1CCCCC1N', ['amine'])
]

random_bb = RandomBuildingBlock(
    building_blocks=building_blocks,
    key=lambda mol: mol.func_group_infos[0].name == 'amine'
)

similar_bb = SimilarBuildingBlock(
    building_blocks=building_blocks,
    key=lambda mol: mol.func_group_infos[0].name == 'amine'
)

# Create the mutator used to carry out the mutations.
random_mutator = RandomMutation(random_topology,
                                random_bb,
                                similar_bb)

# Mutate a molecule, one of random_topology,
# random_bb or similar_bb will be used.
mutant1 = random_mutator.mutate(cage)

# Mutate the molecule a second time, one of random_topology,
# random_bb or similar_bb will be used.
mutant2 = random_mutator.mutate(cage)

# Mutate a mutant, one of random_topology,
# random_bb or similar_bb will be used.
mutant3 = random_mutator.mutate(mutant1)
__init__(*mutators, weights=None)¶

Initializes a RandomMutation instance.

Parameters:
  • *mutators (Mutator) – Mutator objects which are used to carry out the mutations.
  • weights (list of float, optional) – The probability that each Mutator will be selected to carry out a mutation.
mutate(mol)¶

Create a mutant with a Mutator in mutators.

Parameters:mol (Molecule) – The molecule which is to be mutated.
Returns:The produced mutant.
Return type:Molecule
class stk.calculators.ga.mutators.RandomTopology(topologies)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.ga.mutators.Mutator

Changes topologies at random.

Parameters:topologies (list of Topology) – This list holds the topology instances from which one is selected at random to form a mutant.

Examples

# Create a molecule which is to be mutated.
bb1 = StructUnit2.smiles_init('NCCN', ['amine'])
bb2 = StructUnit3.smiles_init('O=CCC(=O)CC=O', ['aldehyde'])
cage = Cage([bb1, bb2], FourPlusSix())

# Create topologies used for substition.
topologies = [
    TwoPlusThree(),
    EightPlusTwelve(),
    Dodecahedron()
]

# Create the mutator.
random_topology = RandomTopology(topologies)

# Mutate a molecule.
mutant1 = random_topology.mutate(cage)

# Mutate the molecule a second time.
mutant2 = random_topology.mutate(cage)

# Mutate a mutant.
mutant3 = random_topology.mutate(mutant1)
__init__(topologies)¶

Initializes a RandomTopology instance.

Parameters:topologies (list of Topology) – This lists holds the topology instances from which one is selected at random to form a new molecule.
mutate(mol)¶

Substitute a random topology.

Parameters:mol (MacroMolecule) – The molecule which is to have its topology substituted.
Returns:The produced mutant.
Return type:MacroMolecule
class stk.calculators.ga.mutators.SimilarBuildingBlock(building_blocks, key, duplicate_building_blocks)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.ga.mutators.Mutator

Substitutes similar building blocks.

This mutator takes a MacroMolecule and substitutes the building blocks with the most similar one from a given set.

building_blocks¶

A group of molecules which are used to replace building blocks in molecules being mutated.

Type:list of StructUnit
key¶

A function which takes a StructUnit and returns True or False. This function is applied to every building block of the molecule being mutated. Building blocks which returned True are liable for substition by one of the molecules in building_blocks.

Type:function
duplicate_building_blocks¶

Indicates whether the building blocks used to construct the mutant must all be unique.

Type:bool
_similar_bbs¶

Maps a MacroMolecule to multiple iterator, each of which yields the most similar molecules in building_blocks, in order.

Type:dict

Examples

# Create a molecule which is to be mutated.
bb1 = StructUnit2.smiles_init('NCCN', ['amine'])
bb2 = StructUnit2.smiles_init('O=CCC=O', ['aldehyde'])
polymer = Polymer([bb1, bb2], Linear('AB', [0, 0], n=3))

# Create molecules used to substitute building blocks.
building_blocks = [
    StructUnit2.smiles_init('NC[Si]CCN', ['amine']),
    StructUnit2.smiles_init('NCCCCCCCN', ['amine']),
    StructUnit2.smiles_init('NC1CCCCC1N', ['amine'])
]

# Create the mutator.
similar_bb = SimilarBuildingBlock(
    building_blocks=building_blocks,
    key=lambda mol: mol.func_group_infos[0].name == 'amine'
)

# Mutate a molecule.
mutant1 = random_bb.mutate(polymer)

# Mutate the molecule a second time.
mutant2 = random_bb.mutate(polymer)

# Mutate a mutant.
mutant3 = random_bb.mutate(mutant1)
__init__(building_blocks, key, duplicate_building_blocks)¶

Initializes a RandomBuildingBlock instance.

Parameters:
  • building_blocks (list of StructUnit) – A group of molecules which are used to replace building blocks in molecules being mutated.
  • key (function) – A function which takes a StructUnit and returns True or False. This function is applied to every building block of the molecule being mutated. Building blocks which returned True are liable for substition by one of the molecules in building_blocks.
  • duplicate_building_blocks (bool, optional) – Indicates whether the building blocks used to construct the mutant must all be unique.
mutate(mol)¶

Substitute a similar building block.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The molecule which is to have its building block substituted.
Returns:The produced mutant.
Return type:MacroMolecule
